channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves constantly swept to the side, 22nd July
item.description:
For some reason the leaves are constantly swept just to the side in front of Greenwich academy. Never picked up or cleared. It’s been more than a year like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Blackheath Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping furniture, 22nd July
item.description:
Flytipping of a lot of furniture. Double bed, mattress, cabinets
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Darrell Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytippin, 22nd July
item.description:
Some roofing felt/ heavy duty plastic and garden waste have been dumped on the pavement. Eventually someone put them in wheelie bin but they were not collected last Friday
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cherry Tree Walk, Upper Elmers End, London

item.title: Street lights, 22nd July
item.description:
Lights are not working at Roman Square car park next to 23,25,19,17 and garages behind
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roman Square, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive dog off the lead behaving aggressive, 22nd July
item.description:
Today I walked my son in the buggy on se93ha and this massive dog came out of house number 17 making his way our way and the owner made no efforts to grab him, I froze, she was completely dismissive of my fear. It is my understanding that he has been aggressive towards others dog walkers on the road and they haven’t made a complaint to avoid falling out with the owner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hever Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly cut verges, 22nd July
item.description:
Verges in Townshend Road were mowed and strimmed yesterday and they look terrible. Left half done in some places with tall weeds and grass destroyed in other areas. Needs more care taken

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Townshend Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree leaves are blocking the passage, 22nd July
item.description:
Please cut the branches of this tree which has overgrown and is blocking the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Simms Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street separator knocked down, 22nd July
item.description:
The cross between simms road and st James road has some separators to protect the zebra crossing from cars. Several are knocked down as they were hit by cars. Please repair as these are important to keep this crossing safe. There are several children from nearby schools and nurseries using this cross everyday.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Simms Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress flytipped, 22nd July
item.description:
A mattress has been consistent fly tipped

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Way, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Six bags of rubbish dumped in Ormiston Road, 22nd July
item.description:
Foxes have pulled food waste from the dumped bags and scattered foul items along the pavement. The pavement is used daily by children and parents walking to and from Halstow Road school. The area is becoming a health hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halstow Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple items dumped inside and outside of garages/, 22nd July
item.description:
This issue has been a problem for the last month, and it is attracting vermin, foxes, and rough sleepers. This is problematic for the residents at 167-191 Wrens Park and the adjacent houses.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alarm going off at night, 22nd July
item.description:
The alarm of the car has been going off for two nights. We have gone around Rowley Avenue and Hartcourt, no one identified the vehicle

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 161A, Rowley Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging alley overgrown, 22nd July
item.description:
The trees growing over the public alley are overgrown and need to suck to get through

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durban Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Arnos Grove Underground Station Bus Stop, 22nd July
item.description:
The sand pit is completely full of trash. It’s disgusting. Been like this for months. Why is no one cleaning this mess. Where are the road sweepers?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes Road, New Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barried pile of rubble without sign or lights at night very near corner, 22nd July
item.description:
Been here since at least last Saturday. Traffic have to move out into middle of road to circumvent. Traffic coming the other way are blind as they come around the corner. NO warning signs and no lights at night. Thankfully school nearby which would increase traffic here has broken up but it is an accident waiting to happen. No idea who's stuff by 34 Chelsfield recently done works building a wall ...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northfield Avenue, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dogs in the main area of St George's square gardens, 22nd July
item.description:
Dogs are walked and let to play in the main garden despite there being a dedicated dog exercise area right next to it. Please lock the gates between the two parts of the garden and put clear signs for information of dog owners.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St George's Square, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping, 22nd July
item.description:
This area is used by local shops to keep there waste bins. The problem is the bins are always overflowing, and as some of the shops sell food, there is always a strong smell of rotting food. These bins are located between Boots and TG Jones on Eltham High Street. Added to this people seem to think this area is also a public toilet and use it as such anytime day and night, apart from being quite concerning this adds to.the vile stench that eminates from the bin area. Even in the winter the smell is there but obviously it's much worse in the summer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Eltham High Street, Well Hall, Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Groups of people drinking and leaving litter, 22nd July
item.description:
There's usually a group of people drinking heavily, being noisy and leaving rubbish and litter in this area including chairs and their empty bottles.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chairs blocking pavement, 22nd July
item.description:
This is the 3rd report in a month and still no response. Ebenezer's barber shop keeps blocking the pavement with chairs, stools and the same bike in the same place. In the photo you can see a woman and young girl had to walk into the road to get passed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish in road, 22nd July
item.description:
Lots of rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dale Road, Crayford, London
